intro: Tordylium brachytaenium, commonly known as the short-tailed tordylium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
